intro: Lasiandra sulcata, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive zigzagging stems. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Lasiandra sulcata thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
